questions.question_text: Which is the lowest level of the CSA STAR program?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Security, Trust, and Assurance Registry (STAR) Program is a cloud security certification framework that provides three levels of assurance. The lowest level is Self-Assessment, where cloud providers complete a self-reported questionnaire based on the Consensus Assessments Initiative Questionnaire (CAIQ) or Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM).

CSA STAR Program Levels:
Level 1 - Self-Assessment â†’ The lowest level, where the provider self-reports security controls using CSA's CAIQ/CCM.
Level 2 - Attestation / Certification â†’ Independent third-party audit of the providerâ€™s security controls.
Level 3 - Continuous Monitoring â†’ Ongoing security assessments for real-time compliance monitoring.

Selected Answer: C
An SOC 3 (System and Organization Controls 3) report is a publicly available summary of an SOC 2 report, designed to provide a seal of approval that an organization follows strong security and compliance practices without exposing sensitive details.

ðŸ”¹ Primary Purpose of an SOC 3 Report:

Acts as a "seal of approval" to demonstrate trust and transparency.
Summarizes SOC 2 findings without detailed security or audit results.
Used for marketing and public assurance to show that a company meets industry security standards.

Selected Answer: C
C. Seal of approval

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the primary purpose of an SOC 3 report?
Which of the following is not an example of a highly regulated environment?
questions.answer_description: Wholesalers or distributors are generally not regulated, although the products they sell may be.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Wholesale or distribution

questions.question_text: Which of the following methods of addressing risk is most associated with insurance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Legal controls refer to security and compliance measures that ensure an organization meets laws, regulations, and contractual obligations within a cloud environment. These controls help address privacy, data protection, liability, and industry-specific legal requirements.
ðŸ”¹ Examples of Legal Controls in Cloud Computing:
GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) â†’ Protects personal data in the EU.
HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) â†’ Regulates healthcare data security.
CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act) â†’ Ensures consumer data rights in California.
SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley Act) â†’ Governs financial data integrity.

Selected Answer: D
All the other options are standards and not laws. Example of laws are HIPAA, GDPR, etc.
NIST is also more government directed and mandatory
C is not the answer because it limits to U.S. only while D doesnot.

questions.question_text: Legal controls refer to which of the following?

choices.D: Controls designed to comply with laws and regulations related to the cloud environment
